text: The Assata Shakur Community Library () is a library in São Paulo, Brazil. It was started by the Ujima Organization to help educate black Brazilians, promote black culture, and spread the work of black writers. The library opened in 2019 in the neighborhood of Vila Formosa. It is named after Assata Shakur, who used to be in the Black Liberation Army and the Black Panthers. The library also distributed food and supplies during the COVID-19 pandemic. == References == Category:Libraries Category:Buildings and structures in São Paulo
title: Biblioteca Comunitária Assata Shakur
